abstracts.cdata!:
This amendment to the Development Credit
            Agreement and the Loan Agreement of the Irrigation
            Rehabilitation and Restructuring Project is intended to
            assist in the restructuring of the irrigation sector, and to
            utilize project savings (US$650,000) to help finance
            severance payments to the staff of the project's eight
            Water Management Organizations (WMOs), which operate and
            manage the irrigation schemes. The amendments to the legal
            agreements would introduce a new activity into the
            Institutional Development component of the project, namely,
            support for WMO restructuring, including provision of
            Severance Payments to the employees of eight WMOs in Tikves,
            Bregalnica, and Polog. In addition, a new disbursement
            category would be introduced for retrenchment costs, and
            minor adjustments to other expenditure categories would be
            made. Political and economic factors due to retrenchment are
            likely to be mitigated by a strong farmers support, while it
            is expected that the social impacts of retrenchment will not
            be seriously adverse in this particular case. The amendment
            to the loan and credit agreements complies with the Articles
            of Agreement, and it is recommended it be approved.
